author: Boone Bergsma
title: ADA MakerSpace Accelerator
description: Many people have great ideas they want to build on Cardano, but they lack DEV capabilities to get from an Idea to a MVP they can test out.

assessments.note: Seems a valid idea and may certainly contribute to developer ecosystem. I'm not convinced about the value for what they are saying they want to do. There are resources located within the PC community that already act as pathways for budding developers and this proposal appears to simply redirect those resources.
Not clear it meets this challenge. This seems like it should be in the proposer outreach fund.
A really good initiative that will contribute to the Cardano ecosystem.

The proposed accelerator program addresses a challenge that could result in enriching and expanding the Cardano ecosystem as a whole. The initiative has merit, but I fail to see how it directly relates to the developer ecosystem challenge. It could be that some of the projects selected in the accelerator would address this challenge, but no direct mention of this is made in the proposal.

The description of the problem and solution makes sense, is reasonable and the proposal is aligned with the concept of this challenge in different ways through support structures, incentive models and the videos produced can be used as a knowledge base and reference for new teams / developers interested in use Lean Startup Principles to launch their ideas on Cardano.

In addition, the development of the MVPs would be recorded lessons available on our YouTube Channel to help others learn how to build on Cardano.

I recommend the inclusion of more objective metrics, deliverables and KPIs, as the only metric included is subjective for impact assessment. (6 Minimal Viable Products (MVPs) for the Idea Teams to use in their go-to-market strategy.)

The idea is interesting in the sense of supporting teams to develop their projects, as I understand it, according to the Lean Startup Principles. However, it doesn't come to me that the action is focused directly on the developers, which is the focus of this objective. Perhaps this proposal would be better suited to the challenge of reaching the proponent, because it is something that can attract and guide more diverse teams with their ideas. A website that talks more about the ADA Makerspace has been attached, and a 1-hour video on the space and some of its objectives is made available on the home page, which I consider to be a very excessive time to present the subject. This video would be suitable for people who are already interested in participating in the project, but it would be more interesting a short video that can introduce the subject in a cheaper and simpler way.

I believe the team certainly have the necessary experience but am not convinced that they are offering anything that could not already be sourced via CP platforms. The plan asks for significant funds which it states will be used to pay developers to produce MVP. I feel this aspect requires further attention to flesh the details.

The experience of the team and their involvement and commitment to the Catalyst project gives me confidence that accelerator program would be implemented successfully. The budget is concise and the fact that the proposers are not looking to this proposal as a means to compensate themselves should be noted. The eventual success of the projects participating in the accelerator program cannot be guaranteed, but at this point in the life of Project Catalyst I feel it's a risk well worth taking.

The team already actively participates in the Cardano community, with Boone being one of the first members of Catalyst (since Fund1). The team has already been financing for the first version of the ADA Makerspace (Fund3) and has demonstrated its capacity for the good performance presented.

I recommend including more information about the team (their jobs and qualifications / Linkedin) for the sake of transparency and easy access to the community.

There is a reasonable plan. There is information on the budget distribution and a reasonable timeline (16 weeks).

Unlike most proposals, here we already see the formation of a team, not a single person who has the idea and desire to execute it. It is said that the team in question has experience with incubators and are masters of Lean Startup Principles. However, it would be interesting to exemplify a little better about this experience and identify who the team members are. On the attached website we can see that the idea of the project is already under development, as in the video available on the home page, which is always positive, but I did not find any tab talking about the members of the team itself.

I feel that the proposal is a reasonable initiative but have concerns with the amount of information regarding budget and governance. It seems to ignore current resources freely available (albeit not entirely easy for anyone to access). This for me would be a reasonable point of difference and I would be more comfortable with this proposal being scaled back and being submitted to the onboarding challenge.
Whilst it is feasible, it is not clear it addresses the challenge.
More information about the breakdown of the budget would be a plus.

In a way this is an open ended proposal, the deliverables described in the proposal itself would be easy to audit, but the actual impact of the proposal itself on the Cardano ecosystem is dependant on the success or failure of the project selected to be a part of the accelerator program.

There is a 16-week timeline, but there are no milestones or KPIs. A single metric has been defined (6 Minimal Viable Products (MVPs) for the Idea Teams to use in their go-to-market strategy.) And it is subjective as it doesn't allow to audit the quality of what is being developed.

The team will provide videos of the cohorts and the development of the MVPs, which is an important element for auditability.

I recommend including more details about the team.

Pelo o que eu entendi, a execução do projeto se daria por meio de vídeos no youtube, mas fora isso não é dita mais nenhuma informação sobre como essa "consultoria" de fato seria feita. Temos também o tempo total de acompanhamento e uma divisão de $6000 por equipe, mas como esse dinheiro seria usado, exatamente? Acho que faltou detalhamento de uma maneira geral, tanto em questão da execução do projeto, inclusão de datas, quanto na parte de explicar como o financiamento de cada equipe seria feito. Uma sugestão que eu tenho, além de incluir esse detalhes, seria de investir em uma ou duas equipes primeiramente, medir e analisar os resultados para então dar continuidade ao projeto, pois me parece uma quantia muito alta para ser a inicial.

solution: ADA MakerSpace will take a cohort of entrepreneurs through a 16 week Accelerator Program in which we will build their Minimal Viable Product
experience: Team Members of ADA MakerSpace have taken part in many Accelerators, Incubators, Hackathons, and become masters of Lean Startup Principles.
